Tsunade drifted through the shadowy limbo between the light of consciousness and the darkness of unconsciousness. Fragments of images, feelings, and sensations flit through the murky edges of her mind. Slowly, the kunoichi managed to piece together a portion of what had befallen her to put her in this situation. She remembered being alone in bed late at night. Something had awoken her. She tried to remember what it was, but could only come up with a deep droning noise that she had felt more than heard and a blinding light before her room had vanished around her and everything had gone dark.

Dimly, she became aware of a nagging pain in her extremities. Forcing the sensation aside to try and concentrate on the situation proved fruitless. The ache soon spread up her arms and legs and into her torso. Soon enough, the feeling dragged her up into the light and she awoke. The pain was even worse now, a constant torment that made her want to retreat back to unconsciousness to get away from it. But the peace would not come. Steeling herself, she tried to gain some information about what was happening in the hopes of improving the situation.

A dim reddish orb floated above her, where she laid prone. Everything beyond the scope of the light spilling from the orb was lost in shadows, but she could tell that there were things hidden in the darkness even if she couldn’t tell what was out there. Fighting against the pain, she tried to rise, but found that she couldn’t. Craning her head, she managed to make out small circular bonds extending out of the table she was apparently lying on. Gritting her teeth, she tried her best to tear through the small amount of crystalline material, but was surprised that even her considerable strength had no effect on what was holding her down. Judging from how she couldn’t move her legs either, she assumed that her ankles were likely similarly held.

The orb above suddenly flared brighter for a moment, and she cried out in pain as a sharp spike of agony drove between her eyes. Then the spike seemed to shatter within her head sending flaming shards into every corner of her mind. The shock almost made her slip back into oblivion, but something fought against it and dragged her back up out of the blissful darkness.

It was several moments before Tsunade realized that the pain had stopped, not only the one in her head, but also the one that had filled the rest of her body. Above her, the orb had dimmed again, releasing so little light that she could barely even see her bust as it rose and feel with her breath. She could somewhat make out the sheen of sweat that had broken out there as well as across most of her body as the movement caught what little light there was. She lay there, letting her eyes drift shut and savoring the peace that spread throughout her body.

Chittering noises made her snap her head to the side to try and see where it came from. There, barely visible in the darkness, she could see a shape moving slightly. A vague shape beside it moved then, adding another set of chittering almost as if in conversation. Several more back and forth noises came from the two shapes.
